MusicDB
  • Docs »
  • MusicDBTags
  • View page source

MusicDBTags¶

This class handles the different tags for songs and albums. Details about the concept of tags can be found here in the lib.db.musicdb documentation.

Example

database = MusicDatabase("./music.db")
config   = MusicDBConfig("./musicdb.ini")
tags     = MusicDBTags(config, database)

tags.CreateGenre("Metal")                   # Create a genre "Metal"
tags.CreateSubgenre("Dark Metal", "Metal")  # Create a subgenre of "Metal" and name it "Dark Metal"

MusicDBTags Class¶

class mdbapi.tags.MusicDBTags(config, database)[source]¶
Parameters:
  • config – MusicDB configuration object
  • database – MusicDB database
Raises:

TypeError – when config or database not of type MusicDBConfig or MusicDatabase
CreateGenre(name)[source]¶

See lib.db.musicdb.MusicDatabase.CreateTag()

CreateMood(name)[source]¶

See lib.db.musicdb.MusicDatabase.CreateTag()

CreateSubgenre(name, parentname)[source]¶

The parent name gets translated to its genre id. As mentioned in the tag concept (see musicdb), only subgenre can have parents. And those parents must be of class genre.

For further details see lib.db.musicdb.MusicDatabase.CreateTag()

DeleteGenre(name)[source]¶

See lib.db.musicdb.MusicDatabase.DeleteTag()

DeleteMood(name)[source]¶

See lib.db.musicdb.MusicDatabase.DeleteTag()

DeleteSubgenre(name)[source]¶

See lib.db.musicdb.MusicDatabase.DeleteTag()

GetAllGenres()[source]¶

See lib.db.musicdb.MusicDatabase.GetAllTags()

GetAllMoods()[source]¶

See lib.db.musicdb.MusicDatabase.GetAllTags()

GetAllSubgenres()[source]¶

See lib.db.musicdb.MusicDatabase.GetAllTags()

ModifyGenre(tagname, newname=None, newicon=None, newcolor=None, newposx=None, newposy=None)[source]¶

See ModifyTag().

All arguments can also be None

Parameters:
  • tagname (str) – Name of the tag that shall be modified
  • newname (str) – New name of the tag
  • newicon (str) – New icon for the tag - the icon-type gets detected automatically
  • newcolor (str) – New color for the tag
  • newposx (int) – New position
  • newposy (int) – New position
ModifyMood(tagname, newname=None, newicon=None, newcolor=None, newposx=None, newposy=None)[source]¶

See ModifyTag().

All arguments can also be None

Parameters:
  • tagname (str) – Name of the tag that shall be modified
  • newname (str) – New name of the tag
  • newicon (str) – New icon for the tag - the icon-type gets detected automatically
  • newcolor (str) – New color for the tag
  • newposx (int) – New position
  • newposy (int) – New position
ModifySubgenre(tagname, newname=None, newparent=None, newicon=None, newcolor=None, newposx=None, newposy=None)[source]¶

See ModifyTag().

All arguments can also be None

Parameters:
  • tagname (str) – Name of the tag that shall be modified
  • newname (str) – New name of the tag
  • newparent (str) – Name of the new parent tag
  • newicon (str) – New icon for the tag - the icon-type gets detected automatically
  • newcolor (str) – New color for the tag
  • newposx (int) – New position
  • newposy (int) – New position
ModifyTag(tagname, tagclass, newname, newparent, newicon, newcolor, newposx, newposy)[source]¶

See lib.db.musicdb.MusicDatabase.ModifyTag()

The icontype gets determined by the newicon-value if not None.

The parentid gets determined by the newparent-name.

Returns:On success False: in case something fails
Return type:True
Raises:AssertionError – Whenever this method does not find wrong values but the database implementation does.
